module_metadata.title: Industry-Specific Zoho Solutions
module_metadata.purpose: Industry-by-industry breakdown of pain points, workflows, and recommended Zoho bundles

industries.typical_business_model: Commission-based sales, recurring rental management fees, or project-based development
industries.common_team_structure: Agents/brokers, sales managers, property managers, admin staff
key_workflows: Lead generation → Nurturing → Site visits → Negotiation → Agreement → Registration
Property listing → Marketing → Inquiry handling → Showing → Closing
Tenant management → Lease agreements → Rent collection → Maintenance requests

top_pain_points.pain_point: Leads scattered across WhatsApp, phone, walk-ins, website - impossible to track
top_pain_points.impact: 30-40% leads lost, no follow-up, duplicate work
questions_to_ask: Where do your property inquiries come from?
How do you assign leads to agents?
What percentage of leads you follow up with?
Can you see which agent has which leads right now?

top_pain_points.pain_point: Site visit scheduling nightmare - double bookings, agent unavailability, client confusion
top_pain_points.impact: Lost time, unprofessional image, missed opportunities
questions_to_ask: How do you schedule property showings?
Ever had double-bookings or agent mixups?
Can clients see available time slots?

top_pain_points.pain_point: Document management chaos - agreements, NOCs, ownership docs scattered
top_pain_points.impact: Deal delays, compliance risks, lost documents
top_pain_points.current_workaround: Physical files, email attachments, Google Drive mess
questions_to_ask: Where do you store property documents?
How long to find a specific document when needed?
Ever lost important paperwork?

top_pain_points.pain_point: Agreement signing delays - waiting for physical signatures
top_pain_points.impact: Deals falling through, buyer impatience, competitive disadvantage
questions_to_ask: How long from agreement to signed contract?
Lost deals due to paperwork delays?
How do you handle remote buyers?

top_pain_points.impact: Agent disputes, calculation errors, delayed payments
questions_to_ask: How do you calculate agent commissions?
Ever had commission disputes?
How long to process commission payments?

recommended_zoho_apps.why: Central lead management, property listing management, deal pipeline tracking, agent performance visibility
Property showing scheduling, virtual tour bookings, eliminate double-bookings
Digital agreement signing, faster closures, remote buyer support
Organized property document storage, easy sharing, version control
Website inquiry forms feeding CRM automatically, property registration forms
Email marketing to property seekers, new listing alerts, market updates

solution_bundles.key_benefits: Organized lead management, fast agreements, automatic lead capture
solution_bundles.typical_roi: 15-30% increase in closures from better follow-up

solution_bundles.key_benefits: Complete sales automation, scheduling, marketing, digital paperwork

solution_bundles.for_business_size: Large agency or developer (20+ agents, multiple projects)
solution_bundles.key_benefits: End-to-end automation from lead to invoicing, project management for developments, complete document management
solution_bundles.typical_roi: 30-50% productivity increase, significantly faster deal velocity

real_world_workflow_example.scenario: Residential real estate agency with 8 agents
real_world_workflow_example.workflow_before: Lead comes via Facebook ad → Agent gets WhatsApp notification → Manually enters in Excel → Calls lead → Schedules site visit on phone → Shows property → Interested → Prints agreement → Courier for signature → Wait 5-7 days → Deal closes or falls through
real_world_workflow_example.workflow_after_zoho: Lead from Facebook ad → Auto-captured in CRM → Auto-assigned to agent by area → Agent gets mobile notification → Checks lead score (Zia AI) → Sends email + WhatsApp from CRM → Lead books site visit via Zoho Bookings → Shows property → Interested → Sends agreement via Zoho Sign → Signed in 24 hours → Deal moves to closed → Commission calculated automatically
real_world_workflow_example.time_saved: 5-7 days per deal → 1-2 days per deal
real_world_workflow_example.roi_explanation: With 100 leads/month, additional 11 closures. Average commission $1,200. Additional revenue: $13,200/month. Investment: $200/month. ROI: 66x

objections_you_will_face.we_manage_with_excel: Excel works until you scale. With 8 agents and 100+ leads/month, Excel breaks. Leads fall through cracks. Can your Excel send automatic reminders? Track email opens? Assign leads by area automatically?
objections_you_will_face.agents_wont_use_it: We've seen this. Key is mobile app - agents live on phones. CRM on phone is easier than WhatsApp + Excel. Plus management visibility means better accountability.
objections_you_will_face.too_expensive: Let's calculate: You're closing X deals/month with Y% follow-up rate. If CRM increases follow-up to 90% and close rate by even 5%, that's Z additional deals × commission. Math works?
objections_you_will_face.we_tried_crm_before: Which one? Why did it fail? Usually: wrong CRM (too complex), poor implementation, no training. Zoho CRM is built for real estate, we ensure proper setup and team adoption.

industries.discovery_call_script: I help real estate agencies organize their lead management and close more deals. Quick questions: 1) How many leads do you get per month? 2) How are you tracking them currently? 3) What percentage do you follow up with? 4) Can you see right now which agent has which leads and their status? 5) What happens when a lead comes in - what's the process? [Listen for chaos indicators] Based on what you're saying, here's how we've helped similar agencies...

industries.common_team_structure: Sales, production planning, inventory manager, quality control, dispatch, accounts
key_workflows: Inquiry → Quotation → Order → Production planning → Raw material procurement → Manufacturing → Quality check → Dispatch → Invoicing → Payment collection
Inventory management: Purchase orders → Goods receipt → Stock tracking → Reorder management
Sales order → Work order → BOM → Production → Stock update → Delivery

top_pain_points.pain_point: Production planning chaos - no visibility into order pipeline vs capacity
top_pain_points.impact: Delayed deliveries, overtime costs, customer dissatisfaction
questions_to_ask: How do you plan production based on incoming orders?
Can you see your production capacity vs orders right now?
How often do you miss delivery deadlines?
How do you prioritize which orders to produce first?

top_pain_points.pain_point: Inventory management nightmare - stock-outs of raw materials stopping production OR overstocking tying up cash
top_pain_points.impact: Production halts, rush purchases at inflated prices, or $50K-500K stuck in excess inventory
top_pain_points.current_workaround: Manual stock registers, periodic physical counts, reactive ordering
questions_to_ask: How do you track raw material inventory?
How often do you run out of critical materials?
How much money is tied up in excess inventory?
How do you decide when to reorder?

top_pain_points.pain_point: Quotation to order conversion tracking - no visibility into sales pipeline
top_pain_points.impact: Can't forecast production, can't plan capacity, surprises every month
top_pain_points.current_workaround: Sales team verbal updates, Excel sheets
questions_to_ask: How do you track quotations sent vs orders received?
Can you forecast next month's production volume accurately?
What's your quotation to order conversion rate?

top_pain_points.pain_point: Bill of Materials (BOM) management and costing accuracy
top_pain_points.impact: Incorrect costing leading to losses, material waste, pricing errors
questions_to_ask: How do you manage BOMs for different products?
How accurate is your product costing?
Ever discovered you're selling at a loss?

top_pain_points.pain_point: Payment collection delays - invoices sent, payments not tracked
top_pain_points.impact: Cash flow problems, can't purchase raw materials for next orders
questions_to_ask: How long does it take to receive payment after delivery?
How do you track outstanding payments?
Ever faced cash flow issues despite having orders?

recommended_zoho_apps.why: Sales pipeline management, quotation tracking, customer management, sales forecasting
Raw material and finished goods tracking, purchase orders, reorder points, multi-warehouse management, BOM management
Invoicing, payment tracking, expense management, financial reports, GST compliance
Production planning, job tracking, task management for make-to-order manufacturing
Cross-functional reports - sales vs production, inventory turnover, profitability by product

solution_bundles.for_business_size: Small manufacturing unit (10-30 employees, simple products)
solution_bundles.key_benefits: Basic inventory control, financial management, invoicing
solution_bundles.typical_roi: Reduced stock-outs, better cash flow visibility

solution_bundles.for_business_size: Medium manufacturing (30-100 employees, multiple product lines)
solution_bundles.key_benefits: End-to-end: sales to production to delivery to payment
solution_bundles.typical_roi: 20-30% reduction in stock-outs, 15% faster order fulfillment, improved cash flow

real_world_workflow_example.scenario: Metal fabrication company, custom orders, 45 employees
real_world_workflow_example.workflow_before: Customer inquiry via email → Manual quotation in Excel → Quotation sent → Order confirmed verbally → Excel sheet updated → Raw material ordered when noticed shortage → Production when materials arrive → Manual invoice in Word → Payment tracking in notebook
real_world_workflow_example.workflow_after_zoho: Inquiry → CRM lead → Quotation generated from CRM (saved templates) → Sent & tracked → Order confirmed → Auto work order in Projects → Inventory checked automatically → Materials auto-ordered if low → Production tracked → Inventory updated → Invoice from Books → Auto payment reminders → Analytics show profitability per order
real_world_workflow_example.improvements: Order fulfillment: 18 days → 12 days average. Stock-outs: 12/month → 2/month. Payment collection: 45 days average → 32 days average. Profitability visibility: monthly after-the-fact → real-time.
real_world_workflow_example.roi: $450/month investment. Material cost savings (better ordering): $2,000/month. Faster delivery: 15% more orders/month ($8,000 additional revenue). Faster payment: improved cash flow enabling growth. ROI: 22x
